creator: tomofumi@nameinn.com
text:
Hi all,

There is a rpmbuild error that prevent it to complete the job, the last few lines of the logs are:

[quote]
Checking for unpackaged file(s): /usr/lib/rpm/check-files /root/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/httpd-2.4.25-1.x86_64
error: Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found:
   /usr/lib64/httpd/modules/mod_proxy_hcheck.so


RPM build errors:
    Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found:
   /usr/lib64/httpd/modules/mod_proxy_hcheck.so
[/quote]

If I add this line into httpd.spec, it will pass:
%{_libdir}/httpd/modules/mod_proxy_hcheck.so

Thanks.

creator: ashley.maloney@jellyfish.co.uk
text:
I too am seeing the same error

Processing files: httpd-debuginfo-2.4.25-1.x86_64
Checking for unpackaged file(s): /usr/lib/rpm/check-files /root/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/httpd-2.4.25-1.x86_64
error: Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found:
   /usr/lib64/httpd/modules/mod_proxy_hcheck.so


RPM build errors:
    Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found:
   /usr/lib64/httpd/modules/mod_proxy_hcheck.so

creator: accost.abhishek@yahoo.com
text:
Is there a fix for this issue.
I noticed that the httpd.spec file does not ahve the description about the mod-proxy-hcheck.so file which is probably causing this issue.

has anyone been able to get a fix for this?

creator: tomofumi@nameinn.com
text:
Hi, as I said in the 1st post, you can fix this by adding this line in httpd.spec yourself:

%{_libdir}/httpd/modules/mod_proxy_hcheck.so

Just find the nearby lines with similar statements like "%{_libdir}/httpd/modules/mod_xxxxxxx" and insert it.

creator: ylavic.dev@gmail.com

creator: ylavic.dev@gmail.com
text: Backported to 2.4.x with r1800862, will be available in upcoming 2.4.17.
Just for the records, it will be in 2.4.27.
